intro: Leptochilus ellipticus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rockcress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are elongated and narrow, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. The species is often found in coastal and inland areas where it thrives in well-drained, sunny environments.
